content.content: The D3M can be viewed as a tool to inject DAI liquidity into an external protocol. You can read the technical details here. The generalization to version 2 along with flexible targeting makes the D3M able to connect into all protocols that accept DAI. In my personal opinion the majority of DAI will be generated via D3Ms as Maker moves from interacting directly with borrowers to becoming a credit wholesaler to protocols that can specialize.

content.content: This is a summary of the governance impact of ratifying this amendment from GovAlpha’s perspective:  MIP4c2-SP23 amends MIP50 - Dai Direct Deposit Module (D3M)  The D3M was initially conceived to be used  specifically by lending protocols. This amendment broadens the D3M to external protocols that allow users to deposit / withdraw DAI. The targeting mechanism was amended to make it more flexible. Details that were restrictive were removed. MIP50c1 was amended to describe the three components that make up the D3M:  D3MHub: the primary manager component D3MPool: an adapter that withdraws/deposits Dai on the external protocol following D3MHub instructions D3MPlan: it determines the target debt and communicates it to the D3MHub so that action is taken to reach this target debt as soon as possible.   This amendment does not include an onboarding component. Protocols wishing to utilize the D3M will continue to be directed to the established collateral onboarding process. This amendment has been assigned Medium-Impact based on the methodology listed here.
